thread.title: Adopt us -- Effingham animal shelter
thread.title_full: Adopt us -- Effingham animal shelter | savannahnow.com

author: G.G. Rigsby
title: Adopt us -- Effingham animal shelter
text:
Photos Back | Next Ruby Back | Next Kennel Coordinator Amy Hamilton with Maizy. (G.G. Rigsby/Effingham Now). By G.G. Rigsby Ruby is a white rabbit that is available for adoption from the Effingham animal shelter.
She is about a year-and-a-half old and is trained to use a litter box. Her owners surrendered her to the shelter, saying they are moving.
She has not been spayed.
“She’s a nice rabbit,” said Shelter Director Lorna Shelton. “She’s good-natured and doesn’t seem aggressive.”
She can be adopted for a fee of $25.
Also up for adoption this week is Maizy, a 1-year-old Catahoula Leopard Dog.
She would do well with a big yard and active family, Shelton said.
“She’s a little shy at first, but she warms up to people quickly,” Shelton said. “She’d be a great family dog.”
Shelton said the shelter got a truckload of dog food this week from Harvey’s in Springfield and TailsSpin in Pooler. She said the food was very much appreciated.
The fee to adopt animals from the Effingham shelter is $50 for dogs and $40 for cats, which includes shots.
People who adopt animals from the shelter must agree to have them spayed or neutered within 30 days, or be subject to a $200 fine. The shelter is following up to make sure that people abide by the law.
Animals must receive a rabies and a “DAPP” shot — for distemper, adenovirus, parainfluenza and parvovirus.
Someone who adopts can take the animal home but must agree to bring the animal back on a Monday or Thursday to get its shots.
The shelter’s phone number is 912-754-2109. It is open for adoptions Mondays and Thursdays from 1 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. and Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
The office hours, when the shelter accepts drop-offs, are 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Friday.
The address for the shelter’s adoption page is: http://www.effinghamcounty.org/DepartmentsAF/AnimalShelter/AdoptionPage.aspx
